thread.title: Bixler, Sonnen win Ouachita bass battle
thread.title_full: Bixler, Sonnen win Ouachita bass battle

author: hdmoadmin
title: Bixler, Sonnen win Ouachita bass battle
text:
2:00 am - October 20, 2015 Bixler, Sonnen win Ouachita bass battle From left: Kirk Bixler, Dave Keith, Don Langston, Robert Sonnen, Darrell Graham and Bob Brannan (Kurtis Sutley photo) 
By JEFF MEEK 
Managing editor 
Kirk Bixler and Robert Sonnen won first place titles in the latest round of the Hot Springs Village Anglers’ Club tournament trail held on Oct. 9 on expansive Lake Ouachita. 
Bixler won the angler division, with five bass totaling 8.9 pounds. Also with five fish and a second place finish was Dave Keith, whose bass weighed 7.2 pounds. Don Langston took the third spot, with three bass and a weight of 5.8 pounds. Bixler and Keith tied for big bass of the day, with a 2.6 pounder. 
The top three spots in the co-angler division could not have been closer. Three fishermen were all within a two-ounce difference, with Sonnen coming out on top, with two bass weighing 3.5 pounds. Darrell Graham took second with four bass weighing 3.4 pounds, and Bob Brannan took third, with four bass weighing 3.3 pounds. Sonnen won the big bass prize for the co-anglers at an even two pounds. 
Keith and Graham won the boat prize for best catch by boating partners. 
The Hot Springs Village Anglers’ Club will have its next meeting at 7 p.m. on Nov. 3 at the Coronado Community Center. All residents, guests and friends are invited to the meetings, which usually include guest speakers sharing tips, tactics, lake information or something bass fishing-related.
